conclusion: Determine the ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity using given information.
Basketball is dropped from rest at height H and rebounds to height h after inelastic collision.
Gravitational force acting on basketball is mg and air resistance is lambda mg.
Initial potential energy at height H is mgH.
Potential energy is converted to kinetic energy just before hitting the ground: v = sqrt(2gH).
Potential energy at peak after collision is mgh, leading to u = sqrt(2gh).
Ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity is sqrt(h/H).
Air resistance is a constant fraction of gravitational force, lambda mg.
Condition 0 < lambda < (H-h)/(H+h) ensures air resistance does not prevent reaching height h.
Final conclusion: ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity is sqrt(h/H).
